intro: Paracaryum reuteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Paracaryum reuteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
